page.title: 14Farleigh Church
page.content: St Marys Church in the quiet village of Farleigh,is set in the heart of the Surrey countryside.It has been standing there for 900 years,since 1082.The style was brought over from France by the Normans.Inside there are a few ornaments and decorative,brass,memorial plaques.The bell tower has only one bell which is rung by a rope hanging behind the sturdy,wooden door which opens into the church.The porch is not as old as the church.It was built only 400 years ago.There was a fire there which completely ruined the original roof,so it was rebuilt.Inside there is a faint smell of dampness.There are two electric lights and a compline service is lit by candles.There is a vestry which is on the right after the small organ.Left and right of the front porch there are wooden benches.These would be fairly new.
